page.title: 05Park Top Farm
page.content: Mr. and Mrs Wallis own Park Top, the actual farmhouse was built in the nineteenth century.The farm consists of 300 acres.They keep sheep and cows. Sheep is the main livestock, they have 10 rams and 280 ewes,they keep sheep for their wool, not their meat , though about four or five lambs are killed for meat for themselves. They keep cows for milking .They have Freisians, Limousins, Charolais and one Jersey cow and her calf. They use modern machinery for the milking.They have 30 bullocks, which they fatten to sell at market. A good cow costs Â£650. They grow grass for hay and silage. They have sold some land to the army for a firing range (Feldom Range) and now rent it for grazing. The Wallis' farm is mixed and quite prosperous.
